conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C and D.
Predict which container (E or F) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A is at the top left.
B is next to A, slightly to the right.
C is to the right of B.
D is at the top right.

premise: Liquid flows from A down and encounters the first baffle (pink).
conclusion: Liquid from A is directed towards the left side.

premise: Liquid from A is directed towards the left side.
conclusion: Liquid from A continues down and enters container E.

premise: Liquid flows from B down and hits the second baffle (gray).
conclusion: Liquid from B is directed towards the left side.

premise: Liquid from B is directed towards the left side.
conclusion: Liquid from B continues down and enters container E.

premise: Liquid flows from C down and hits the third baffle (cyan).
conclusion: Liquid from C is directed towards the right side.

premise: Liquid from C is directed towards the right side.
conclusion: Liquid from C continues down and enters container F.

premise: Liquid flows from D down and hits the fourth baffle (white).
conclusion: Liquid from D is directed towards the right side.

premise: Liquid from D is directed towards the right side.
conclusion: Liquid from D continues down and enters container F.

premise: Liquids from A and B flow into container E. Liquids from C and D flow into container F.
conclusion: Container E will receive liquid from A and B. Container F will receive liquid from C and D.
